name: homarw
params: class c0, class c1, class c2, class c3, class c4

body.origin:
|- wss(co(c0, c1, c2), c3)
-| wss(co(c0, c1, c2), cuni(crn(c1)))
-| wceq(c3, cuni(crn(c1)))

cumulated.origin:
|- wss(co(c0, c1, c2), c3)
-| wss(co(c0, c1, c2), cuni(crn(c1)))
-| wceq(c3, cuni(crn(c1)))

|- wss(co(c0, c1, c2), c3)
-| wceq(c3, cuni(crn(c1)))

body.origin:
|- wceq(c3, cuni(crn(c1)))
-| wceq(c3, cfv(carw, c4))
-| wceq(c1, cfv(choma, c4))
body.pretty:
⊢ c3 = ⋃ ran(c1)
⊣ c3 =(Arrow ` c4)
⊣ c1 =(HomA ` c4)

cumulated.origin:
|- wss(co(c0, c1, c2), c3)
-| wceq(c3, cfv(carw, c4))
-| wceq(c1, cfv(choma, c4))

comment: A hom-set is a subset of the collection of all arrows. (Contributed by Mario Carneiro, 11-Jan-2017.)
